ygData.subject: Re: [cantera] Premix burner stabilized flame flame
ygData.msgSnippet: File gri30.cti contains three different ideal_gas entries.  The first one, gri30 , does not contain a transport model.  It is for use in kinetics

File gri30.cti contains three different 'ideal_gas' entries.  The first  
one, 'gri30', does not contain a transport model.  It is for use in  
kinetics simulations which don't require transport properties.  The  
second one 'gri30_mix' supplies mixture-averaged transport properties,  
and the third one 'gri30_multi' supplies multicomponent transport  
properties.  To create an object using any entry but the first one in  
the file, you need to call IdealGasMix like this:

gas = IdealGasMix('gri30.cti','gri30_mix');

The documentation for IdealGasMix.m is out of date and does not  
correctly describe this. Also, note that in the released version of  
Cantera, flame simulations can only be done with mixture-averaged  
properties.  Using multicomponent properties in flame simulations will  
be possible in the next release, which should be out in a week or so.

Dave
]


On Nov 17, 2003, at 11:06 AM, scheskis wrote:

> I tried to use  flame1.m demo (with matlab) for calculations with
> GRI3.0 mechanism. I replace the reference from h2o2.cti to
> gri30.cti. I received error: unnown transport model. With h2o2.cti
> all is working OK. Please advice what I need to do.
> I am using CHEMKIN2 now for calculations of the pemixed burner
> stabilized flame with different mechanisms and would like to learn
> the possibility to switch to Cantera for this goal.
